snippet: Despite Wall Street's reported recruiting problems, the nation's financial firms are still drawing top graduates with six-figure incomes that can relieve the financial burden of student loans, a recent college graduate writes.
abstract: Despite Wall Street's reported recruiting problems, the nation's financial firms are still drawing top graduates with six-figure incomes that can relieve the financial burden of student loans, a recent college graduate writes.

headline.main: Elite Colleges and Wall Street's Recruiting Machine
